bill_title: authorize the Game, Fish and Parks Commission to offer  special buck deer licenses to certain nonresident landowners.
keywords: Department of Game, Fish and Parks

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the Game, Fish and Parks Commission to offer special buck deer licenses to certain nonresident landowners. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 41-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If the Game, Fish and Parks Commission provides for special buck deer licenses by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, the commission shall, in those rules, provide that five percent of those licenses are available to nonresident applicants who are landowners in the state. A nonresident applicant shall own at least one hundred sixty acres of farm or ranch land in the state to qualify for a special buck deer license. Any license issued pursuant to this section is valid only on the land owned by the nonresident applicant. No more than two licenses may be issued to the applicant's immediate family. For the purposes of this section, the term, immediate family, means the applicant, the applicant's spouse, and the applicant's children. The commission may, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, establish any application requirements needed to administer this section. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the Game, Fish and Parks Commission to offer special buck deer licenses to certain nonresident landowners. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 41-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If the Game, Fish and Parks Commission provides for east river special buck deer licenses by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, the commission shall, in those rules, provide that an additional five percent of those licenses are available to nonresident applicants who are landowners in the state. A nonresident applicant shall own at least six hundred forty acres of farm or ranch land in those counties included in the east river deer season to qualify for a special buck deer license. Any license issued pursuant to this section is valid only on the land owned by the nonresident applicant. No more than two licenses may be issued to the applicant's immediate family. For the purposes of this section, the term, immediate family, means the applicant, the applicant's spouse, and the applicant's children. The commission may, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, establish any application requirements needed to administer this section.
